newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Renaissance Capital recommends oil shares.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Renaissance Capital recommends oil shares.

text.p: Russian investment bank Renaissance Capital has issued buy recommendations for shares in four Russian oil and gas companies, the bank said on Monday.
Renaissance recommended long-term buys on ordinary and preferred shares of AO Surgutneftegaz and NK LUKoil and ordinary shares of gas producer AO Gazprom.
It gave a long-term "hold" for AO Orenburgneft.
It recommended short-term buys for all six issues except LUKoil common stock, which it rated "hold".
Renaissance said it recommended oil and gas sector companies with strong management rather than those with cheap assets.

Russia has about seven percent of the world's proven oil reserves and 35 percent of natural gas reserves, it said. Analysts often recommend oil companies with undervalued assets, which Renaissance said was an investment strategy mistake.
"Companies that have not made this shift in management (to focusing on financial returns and building shareholder value) are likely to remain 'cheap' for an indefinite period of time," it said.

Renaissance said the sector had weathered most of the trauma of its breakup into individual companies from a state monopoly and that improvements in the Russian tax code, oil transport issues and corporate restructuring set the stage for growth.
"The outlook for profit and cash flow growth is positive as the combination of higher volumes, prices and improvements, albeit modest, in the tax code benefit financial performance," it said.
